Mayor of Istanbul

28 March 2004 – 22 September 2017

Mayor of Beyoğlu
In office
18 April 1999 – 28 March 2004
Turkish politician (1945–2021)

Died
13 February 2021
(2021-02-13)
(aged 76)
Kadir Topbaş moved to Istanbul in 1946 with his family.
He earned a PhD in architectural history from Istanbul University following his education of theology at Marmara University in 1972 and architecture at Mimar Sinan University in 1974.
He earned a PhD in architectural history from Istanbul University following his education of theology at Marmara University in 1972 and architecture at Mimar Sinan University in 1974.

After working as preacher in Edirne, teacher and freelance architect in İstanbul, he served between 1994 and 1998, as advisor to then-mayor of Istanbul Recep Tayyip Erdoğan for the restoration and decoration of palaces and other historical buildings in Istanbul.
Later on, Topbaş ran twice for the deputy of Artvin province in the parliament, first in 1977 from the MSP and then in 1987 from Refah Partisi (RP) without success.
Later on, Topbaş ran twice for the deputy of Artvin province in the parliament, first in 1977 from the MSP and then in 1987 from Refah Partisi (RP) without success.
was elected mayor of Beyoğlu district from the Fazilet Partisi (FP)
and won on 28 March 2004
in November 2007
2008 World Mayor award
Kadir Topbaş was re-elected as the mayor of İstanbul metropolitan area in 2009 Turkish general local elections
Topbaş was appointed President of the Union of Municipalities of Turkey in 2009
During the Gezi Park protests in mid-2013
2016 Turkish coup d'état attempt
Near the end of Topbaş's mayoral tenure in 2017
He resigned as the mayor of Istanbul metropolitan area on 22 September 2017
was elected as his successor by the Council of Istanbul Metropolitan Municipality on 28 September
Kadir Topbaş Chowk in Lahore, Pakistan inaugurated by Kadir Topbaş, The Mayor of Istanbul (Turkey) on 12 March 2012
In November 2020, Topbaş was hospitalized for COVID-19 during the COVID-19 pandemic in Turkey.
He died on 13 February 2021, due to multiple organ failure amidst being treated for COVID-19 complications.
Order of Cultural Merit, South Korea, 12 September 2014, Seoul
Istanbul's mayor announces his sudden resignation. Associated Press News. 22 September 2017.
Mayor of İstanbul 28 March 2004 – 22 September 2017
